types.name: Authority
types.description: Authority involved in public transportation. An organisation under which the responsibility of organising the transport service in a certain area is placed.

fields.name: situations
fields.description: Get all situations active for the authority.

enumValues.name: noInformation
enumValues.description: There is no bike information for the trip.

enumValues.name: allowed
enumValues.description: The vehicle being used on this particular trip can accommodate at least one bicycle.

enumValues.name: notAllowed
enumValues.description: No bicycles are allowed on this trip.

fields.name: bookingMethods
fields.description: How should service be booked?

fields.name: latestBookingTime
fields.description: Latest time service can be booked. ISO 8601 timestamp

fields.name: minimumBookingPeriod
fields.description: Minimum period in advance service can be booked as a ISO 8601 duration

fields.name: bookingNote
fields.description: Textual description of booking arrangement for service

fields.name: bookingContact
fields.description: Who should ticket be contacted for booking

types.name: Boolean
types.description: Built-in Boolean

fields.name: contactPerson
fields.description: Name of person to contact

fields.name: email
fields.description: Email adress for contact

fields.name: url
fields.description: Url for contact

fields.name: phone
fields.description: Phone number for contact

fields.name: furtherDetails
fields.description: Textual description of how to get in contact

types.name: Date
types.description: Local date using the ISO 8601 format: `YYYY-MM-DD`. Example: `2020-05-17`.

types.name: DateTime
types.description:
DateTime format accepting ISO 8601 dates with time zone offset.

Format:  `YYYY-MM-DD'T'hh:mm[:ss](Z|Â±01:00)`

Example: `2017-04-23T18:25:43+02:00` or `2017-04-23T16:25:43Z`

types.name: DestinationDisplay
types.description: An advertised destination of a specific journey pattern, usually displayed on a head sign or at other on-board locations.

fields.name: frontText
fields.description: Name of destination to show on front of vehicle.

types.name: EstimatedCall
types.description: List of visits to quays as part of vehicle journeys. Updated with real time information where available

fields.name: aimedArrivalTime
fields.description: Scheduled time of arrival at quay. Not affected by read time updated

fields.name: expectedArrivalTime
fields.description: Expected time of arrival at quay. Updated with real time information if available. Will be null if an actualArrivalTime exists

fields.name: actualArrivalTime
fields.description: Actual time of arrival at quay. Updated from real time information if available. NOT IMPLEMENTED

fields.name: aimedDepartureTime
fields.description: Scheduled time of departure from quay. Not affected by read time updated

fields.name: expectedDepartureTime
fields.description: Expected time of departure from quay. Updated with real time information if available. Will be null if an actualDepartureTime exists

fields.name: actualDepartureTime
fields.description: Actual time of departure from quay. Updated with real time information if available. NOT IMPLEMENTED

fields.name: timingPoint
fields.description: Whether this is a timing point or not. Boarding and alighting is not allowed at timing points.

fields.name: realtime
fields.description: Whether this call has been updated with real time information.

fields.name: predictionInaccurate
fields.description: Whether the updated estimates are expected to be inaccurate. NOT IMPLEMENTED

fields.name: forBoarding
fields.description: Whether vehicle may be boarded at quay.

fields.name: forAlighting
fields.description: Whether vehicle may be alighted at quay.

fields.name: requestStop
fields.description: Whether vehicle will only stop on request.

fields.name: cancellation
fields.description: Whether stop is cancellation. NOT IMPLEMENTED

fields.name: date
fields.description: The date the estimated call is valid for.

fields.name: situations
fields.description: Get all relevant situations for this EstimatedCall.

fields.name: bookingArrangements
fields.description: Booking arrangements for flexible service. NOT IMPLEMENTED

enumValues.description: Quay

types.name: Float
types.description: Built-in Float

types.name: ID
types.description: Built-in ID

types.name: InputBanned
types.description: Filter trips by disallowing lines involving certain elements. If both lines and authorities are specified, only one must be valid for each line to be banned. If a line is both banned and whitelisted, it will be counted as banned.

inputFields.name: lines
inputFields.description: Set of ids for lines that should not be used

inputFields.name: authorities
inputFields.description: Set of ids for authorities that should not be used

inputFields.name: quays
inputFields.description: Set of ids of quays that should not be allowed for boarding or alighting. Trip patterns that travel through the quay will still be permitted.

inputFields.name: quaysHard
inputFields.description: Set of ids of quays that should not be allowed for boarding, alighting or traveling thorugh.

inputFields.name: serviceJourneys
inputFields.description: Set of ids of service journeys that should not be used.

types.name: InputCoordinates
types.description: Input type for coordinates in the WGS84 system

inputFields.name: latitude
inputFields.description: The latitude of the place.

inputFields.name: longitude
inputFields.description: The longitude of the place.

inputFields.name: quays
inputFields.description: Quays to include by id.

inputFields.name: lines
inputFields.description: Lines to include by id.

inputFields.name: bikeRentalStations
inputFields.description: Bike rentals to include by id.

inputFields.name: bikeParks
inputFields.description: Bike parks to include by id.

inputFields.name: carParks
inputFields.description: Car parks to include by id.

types.name: InputPreferred
types.description: Preferences for trip search.

inputFields.name: lines
inputFields.description: Set of ids of lines preferred by user.

inputFields.name: authorities
inputFields.description: Set of ids of authorities preferred by user.

inputFields.name: otherThanPreferredLinesPenalty
inputFields.description: Penalty added for using a line that is not preferred if user has set any line as preferred. In number of seconds that user is willing to wait for preferred line.

types.name: InputUnpreferred
types.description: Negative preferences for trip search. Unpreferred elements may still be used in suggested trips if alternatives are not desirable, see InputBanned for hard limitations.

inputFields.name: lines
inputFields.description: Set of ids of lines user prefers not to use.

inputFields.name: authorities
inputFields.description: Set of ids of authorities user prefers not to use.

types.name: InputWhiteListed
types.description: Filter trips by only allowing lines involving certain elements. If both lines and authorities are specified, only one must be valid for each line to be used. If a line is both banned and whitelisted, it will be counted as banned.

inputFields.name: lines
inputFields.description: Set of ids for lines that should be used

inputFields.name: authorities
inputFields.description: Set of ids for authorities that should be used

types.name: Int
types.description: Built-in Int

fields.name: staySeated
fields.description: Time that the trip departs. NOT IMPLEMENTED

fields.name: guaranteed
fields.description: Time that the trip departs. NOT IMPLEMENTED

types.name: Leg
types.description: Part of a trip pattern. Either a ride on a public transport vehicle or access or path link to/from/between places

fields.name: aimedStartTime
fields.description: The aimed date and time this leg starts.

fields.name: expectedStartTime
fields.description: The expected, realtime adjusted date and time this leg starts.

fields.name: aimedEndTime
fields.description: The aimed date and time this leg ends.

fields.name: expectedEndTime
fields.description: The expected, realtime adjusted date and time this leg ends.

fields.name: mode
fields.description: The mode of transport or access (e.g., foot) used when traversing this leg.

fields.name: transportSubmode
fields.description: The transport sub mode (e.g., localBus or expressBus) used when traversing this leg. Null if leg is not a ride

fields.name: duration
fields.description: The legs's duration in seconds

fields.name: directDuration
fields.description: NOT IMPLEMENTED

fields.name: pointsOnLink
fields.description: The legs's geometry.

fields.name: authority
fields.description: For ride legs, the service authority used for this legs. For non-ride legs, null.

fields.name: operator
fields.description: For ride legs, the operator used for this legs. For non-ride legs, null.

fields.name: realtime
fields.description: Whether there is real-time data about this leg

fields.name: distance
fields.description: The distance traveled while traversing the leg in meters.

fields.name: ride
fields.description: Whether this leg is a ride leg or not.

fields.name: rentedBike
fields.description: Whether this leg is with a rented bike.

fields.name: fromPlace
fields.description: The Place where the leg originates.

fields.name: toPlace
fields.description: The Place where the leg ends.

fields.name: fromEstimatedCall
fields.description: EstimatedCall for the quay where the leg originates.

fields.name: toEstimatedCall
fields.description: EstimatedCall for the quay where the leg ends.

fields.name: line
fields.description: For ride legs, the line. For non-ride legs, null.

fields.name: serviceJourney
fields.description: For ride legs, the service journey. For non-ride legs, null.

fields.name: intermediateQuays
fields.description: For ride legs, intermediate quays between the Place where the leg originates and the Place where the leg ends. For non-ride legs, empty list.

fields.name: intermediateEstimatedCalls
fields.description: For ride legs, estimated calls for quays between the Place where the leg originates and the Place where the leg ends. For non-ride legs, empty list.

fields.name: serviceJourneyEstimatedCalls
fields.description: For ride legs, all estimated calls for the service journey. For non-ride legs, empty list.

fields.name: situations
fields.description: All relevant situations for this leg

fields.name: steps
fields.description: Do we continue from a specified via place

fields.name: interchangeFrom
fields.description: NOT IMPLEMENTED

fields.name: interchangeTo
fields.description: NOT IMPLEMENTED

types.name: Line
types.description: A group of routes which is generally known to the public by a similar name or number

fields.name: publicCode
fields.description: Publicly announced code for line, differentiating it from other lines for the same operator.

fields.name: transportSubmode
fields.description: NOT IMPLEMENTED

fields.name: situations
fields.description: Get all situations active for the line.

fields.name: flexibleLineType
fields.description: Type of flexible line, or null if line is not flexible.

fields.name: bookingArrangements
fields.description: Booking arrangements for flexible line.

types.name: LocalTime
types.description: Time using the format: HH:mm:SS. Example: 18:25:SS

types.name: Location
types.description: Input format for specifying a location through either a place reference (id), coordinates or both. If both place and coordinates are provided the place ref will be used if found, coordinates will only be used if place is not known.

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: The name of the location. This is pass-through informationand is not used in routing.

inputFields.name: place
inputFields.description: The id of an element in the OTP model. Currently supports Quay, StopPlace, multimodal StopPlace, and GroupOfStopPlaces.

inputFields.name: coordinates
inputFields.description: Coordinates for the location. This can be used alone or as fallback if the place id is not found.

types.name: Long
types.description: Long type

types.name: Mode
types.description: NOT IMPLEMENTED

enumValues.name: transit
enumValues.description: Any for of public transportation

types.name: Modes
types.description: Input format for specifying which modes will be allowed for this search. If this element is not present, it will default to accessMode/egressMode/directMode of foot and all transport modes will be allowed.

inputFields.name: accessMode
inputFields.description: The mode used to get from the origin to the access stops in the transit network the transit network (first-mile). If the element is not present or null,only transit that can be immediately boarded from the origin will be used.

inputFields.name: egressMode
inputFields.description: The mode used to get from the egress stops in the transit network tothe destination (last-mile). If the element is not present or null,only transit that can immediately arrive at the origin will be used.

inputFields.name: directMode
inputFields.description: The mode used to get from the origin to the destination directly, without using the transit network. If the element is not present or null,direct travel without using transit will be disallowed.

inputFields.name: transportMode
inputFields.description: The allowed modes for the transit part of the trip. Use an empty list to disallow transit for this search. If the element is not present or null, it will default to all transport modes.

enumValues.name: parent
enumValues.description: Multi modal parent stop places without their mono modal children.

enumValues.name: child
enumValues.description: Only mono modal children stop places, not their multi modal parent stop

enumValues.name: all
enumValues.description: Both multiModal parents and their mono modal child stop places.

types.name: MultilingualString
types.description: Text with language

types.name: Operator
types.description: Organisation providing public transport services.

types.name: PageInfo
types.description: Information about pagination in a connection.

fields.name: hasNextPage
fields.description: When paginating forwards, are there more items?

fields.name: hasPreviousPage
fields.description: When paginating backwards, are there more items?

fields.name: startCursor
fields.description: When paginating backwards, the cursor to continue.

fields.name: endCursor
fields.description: When paginating forwards, the cursor to continue.

types.name: PathGuidance
types.description: A series of turn by turn instructions used for walking, biking and driving.

fields.name: distance

fields.name: relativeDirection
fields.description: The relative direction of this step.

fields.name: streetName
fields.description: The name of the street.

fields.name: heading
fields.description: The absolute direction of this step.

fields.name: exit
fields.description: When exiting a highway or traffic circle, the exit name/number.

fields.name: stayOn
fields.description: Indicates whether or not a street changes direction at an intersection.

fields.name: area
fields.description: This step is on an open area, such as a plaza or train platform, and thus the directions should say something like "cross"

fields.name: bogusName
fields.description: The name of this street was generated by the system, so we should only display it once, and generally just display right/left directions

fields.name: latitude
fields.description: The latitude of the step.

fields.name: longitude
fields.description: The longitude of the step.

types.name: Place
types.description: Common super class for all places (stop places, quays, car parks, bike parks and bike rental stations )

fields.name: name
fields.description: For transit quays, the name of the quay. For points of interest, the name of the POI.

fields.name: vertexType
fields.description: Type of vertex. (Normal, Bike sharing station, Bike P+R, Transit quay) Mostly used for better localization of bike sharing and P+R station names

fields.name: latitude
fields.description: The latitude of the place.

fields.name: longitude
fields.description: The longitude of the place.

fields.name: quay
fields.description: The quay related to the place.

fields.name: bikeRentalStation
fields.description: The bike rental station related to the place

fields.name: id
fields.deprecationReason: Id is not referable or meaningful and will be removed

types.name: PlaceInterface
types.description: Interface for places, i.e. quays, stop places, parks

types.name: PointsOnLink
types.description: A list of coordinates encoded as a polyline string (see http://code.google.com/apis/maps/documentation/polylinealgorithm.html)

fields.name: length
fields.description: The number of points in the string

fields.name: points
fields.description: The encoded points of the polyline. Be aware that the string could contain escape characters that need to be accounted for. (https://www.freeformatter.com/javascript-escape.html)

types.name: Presentation
types.description: Types describing common presentation properties

types.name: PtSituationElement
types.description: Simple public transport situation element

fields.name: authority
fields.description: Get affected authority for this situation element

fields.name: summary
fields.description: Summary of situation in all different translations available

fields.name: description
fields.description: Description of situation in all different translations available

fields.name: advice
fields.description: Advice of situation in all different translations available

fields.name: infoLinks
fields.description: Optional links to more information.

fields.name: validityPeriod
fields.description: Period this situation is in effect

fields.name: reportType
fields.description: ReportType of this situation

fields.name: situationNumber
fields.description: Operator's internal id for this situation

fields.name: reportAuthority
fields.description: Authority that reported this situation
fields.deprecationReason: Not yet officially supported. May be removed or renamed.

types.name: Quay
types.description: A place such as platform, stance, or quayside where passengers have access to PT vehicles.

fields.name: stopPlace
fields.description: The stop place to which this quay belongs to.

fields.name: wheelchairAccessible
fields.description: Whether this quay is suitable for wheelchair boarding.

fields.name: publicCode
fields.description: Public code used to identify this quay within the stop place. For instance a platform code.

fields.name: lines
fields.description: List of lines servicing this quay

fields.name: journeyPatterns
fields.description: List of journey patterns servicing this quay

fields.name: estimatedCalls
fields.description: List of visits to this quay as part of vehicle journeys.

args.name: startTime
args.description: DateTime for when to fetch estimated calls from. Default value is current time

args.name: numberOfDepartures
args.description: Limit the total number of departures returned.

args.name: numberOfDeparturesPerLineAndDestinationDisplay
args.description: Limit the number of departures per line and destination display returned. The parameter is only applied when the value is between 1 and 'numberOfDepartures'.

args.name: whiteListed
args.description: Parameters for indicating the only authorities and/or lines or quays to list estimatedCalls for

args.name: whiteListedModes
args.description: Only show estimated calls for selected modes.

args.name: includeCancelledTrips
args.description: Indicates that realtime-cancelled trips should also be included. NOT IMPLEMENTED

fields.name: situations
fields.description: Get all situations active for the quay.

fields.name: distance
fields.description: The distance in meters to the given quay.

fields.name: trip
fields.description: Input type for executing a travel search for a trip between two locations. Returns trip patterns describing suggested alternatives for the trip.

args.name: dateTime
args.description: Date and time for the earliest time the user is willing to start the journey (if arriveBy=false/not set) or the latest acceptable time of arriving (arriveBy=true). Defaults to now

args.name: searchWindow
args.description: The length of the search-window in minutes. This is normally dynamically calculated by the server, but you may override this by setting it. The search-window used in a request is returned in the response metadata. To get the "next page" of trips use the metadata(searchWindowUsed and nextWindowDateTime) to create a new request. If not provided the value is resolved depending on the other input parameters, available transit options and realtime changes.

args.name: from
args.description: The start location

args.name: to
args.description: The end location

args.name: wheelchairAccessible
args.description: Whether the trip must be wheelchair accessible. NOT IMPLEMENTED

args.name: numTripPatterns
args.description: The maximum number of trip patterns to return for this search window. This may cause relevant trips to be missed, so it is preferable to set this high and use other filtering options instead.

args.name: walkSpeed
args.description: The maximum walk speed along streets, in meters per second

args.name: bikeSpeed
args.description: The maximum bike speed along streets, in meters per second

args.name: bicycleOptimisationMethod
args.description: The set of characteristics that the user wants to optimise for during bicycle searches -- defaults to quick

args.name: arriveBy
args.description: Whether the trip should depart at dateTime (false, the default), or arrive at dateTime.

args.name: preferred
args.description: Parameters for indicating authorities or lines that preferably should be used in trip patters. A cost is applied to boarding nonpreferred authorities or lines (otherThanPreferredRoutesPenalty).

args.name: unpreferred
args.description: Parameters for indicating authorities or lines that preferably should not be used in trip patters. A cost is applied to boarding nonpreferred authorities or lines (otherThanPreferredRoutesPenalty).

args.name: banned
args.description: Parameters for indicating authorities, lines or quays not be used in the trip patterns

args.name: whiteListed
args.description: Parameters for indicating the only authorities, lines or quays to be used in the trip patterns

args.name: transferPenalty
args.description: An extra penalty added on transfers (i.e. all boardings except the first one). The transferPenalty is used when a user requests even less transfers. In the latter case, we don't actually optimise for fewest transfers, as this can lead to absurd results. Consider a trip in New York from Grand Army Plaza (the one in Brooklyn) to Kalustyan's at noon. The true lowest transfers trip pattern is to wait until midnight, when the 4 train runs local the whole way. The actual fastest trip pattern is the 2/3 to the 4/5 at Nevins to the 6 at Union Square, which takes half an hour. Even someone optimise for fewest transfers doesn't want to wait until midnight. Maybe they would be willing to walk to 7th Ave and take the Q to Union Square, then transfer to the 6. If this takes less than transferPenalty seconds, then that's what we'll return.

args.name: modes
args.description: The set of access/egress/direct/transit modes to be used for this search.

args.name: transferSlack
args.description: An expected transfer time (in seconds) that specifies the amount of time that must pass between exiting one public transport vehicle and boarding another. This time is in addition to time it might take to walk between stops.

args.name: boardSlackDefault
args.description: The boardSlack is the minimum extra time to board a public transport vehicle. This is the same as the 'minimumTransferTime', except that this also apply to to the first transit leg in the trip. This is the default value used, if not overridden by the 'boardSlackList'.

args.name: boardSlackList
args.description: List of boardSlack for a given set of modes. Defaults: [air : 2100, water : 60]

args.name: alightSlackDefault
args.description: The alightSlack is the minimum extra time after exiting a public transport vehicle. This is the default value used, if not overridden by the 'alightSlackList'.

args.name: alightSlackList
args.description: List of alightSlack for a given set of modes. Defaults: [air : 900, water : 30]

args.name: maximumTransfers
args.description: Maximum number of transfers

args.name: ignoreRealtimeUpdates
args.description: When true, realtime updates are ignored during this search.

args.name: walkReluctance
args.description: Walk cost is multiplied by this value. This is the main parameter to use for limiting walking.

args.name: debugItineraryFilter
args.description: Debug the itinerary-filter-chain. The filters will mark itineraries as deleted, but NOT delete them when this is enabled.

fields.name: stopPlace
fields.description: Get a single stopPlace based on its id)

fields.name: stopPlaces
fields.description: Get all stopPlaces

fields.name: stopPlacesByBbox
fields.description: Get all stop places within the specified bounding box

args.name: multiModalMode
args.description: MultiModalMode for query. To control whether multi modal parent stop places, their mono modal children or both are included in the response. Does not affect mono modal stop places that do not belong to a multi modal stop place.

args.name: filterByInUse
args.description: If true only stop places with at least one visiting line are included.

fields.name: quay
fields.description: Get a single quay based on its id)

fields.name: quays
fields.description: Get all quays

fields.name: quaysByBbox
fields.description: Get all quays within the specified bounding box

args.name: filterByInUse
args.description: If true only quays with at least one visiting line are included.

fields.name: quaysByRadius
fields.description: Get all quays within the specified walking radius from a location. The returned type has two fields quay and distance

args.name: latitude
args.description: Latitude of the location

args.name: longitude
args.description: Longitude of the location

args.name: radius
args.description: Radius via streets (in meters) to search for from the specified location

args.name: before
args.description: fetching only nodes before this node (exclusive)

args.name: after
args.description: fetching only nodes after this node (exclusive)

args.name: first
args.description: fetching only the first certain number of nodes

args.name: last
args.description: fetching only the last certain number of nodes

fields.name: nearest
fields.description: Get all places (quays, stop places, car parks etc. with coordinates) within the specified radius from a location. The returned type has two fields place and distance. The search is done by walking so the distance is according to the network of walkables.

args.name: latitude
args.description: Latitude of the location

args.name: longitude
args.description: Longitude of the location

args.name: maximumDistance
args.description: Maximum distance (in meters) to search for from the specified location. Default is 2000m.

args.name: maximumResults
args.description: Maximum number of results. Search is stopped when this limit is reached. Default is 20.

args.name: filterByPlaceTypes
args.description: Only include places of given types if set. Default accepts all types

args.name: filterByModes
args.description: Only include places that include this mode. Only checked for places with mode i.e. quays, departures.

args.name: filterByInUse
args.description: Only affects queries for quays and stop places. If true only quays and stop places with at least one visiting line are included.

args.name: filterByIds
args.description: Only include places that match one of the given ids.

args.name: multiModalMode
args.description: MultiModalMode for query. To control whether multi modal parent stop places, their mono modal children or both are included in the response. Does not affect mono modal stop places that do not belong to a multi modal stop place. Only applicable for placeType StopPlace

args.name: before
args.description: fetching only nodes before this node (exclusive)

args.name: after
args.description: fetching only nodes after this node (exclusive)

args.name: first
args.description: fetching only the first certain number of nodes

args.name: last
args.description: fetching only the last certain number of nodes

fields.name: serverInfo
fields.description: Get OTP server information

enumValues.name: scheduled
enumValues.description: The service journey information comes from the regular time table, i.e. no real-time update has been applied.

enumValues.name: updated
enumValues.description: The service journey information has been updated, but the journey pattern stayed the same as the journey pattern of the scheduled service journey.

enumValues.name: canceled
enumValues.description: The service journey has been canceled by a real-time update.

enumValues.name: Added
enumValues.description: The service journey has been added using a real-time update, i.e. the service journey was not present in the regular time table.

enumValues.name: modified
enumValues.description: The service journey information has been updated and resulted in a different journey pattern compared to the journey pattern of the scheduled service journey.

enumValues.name: general
enumValues.description: Indicates a general info-message that should not affect trip.

enumValues.name: incident
enumValues.description: Indicates an incident that may affect trip.

types.name: RoutingParameters
types.description: The default parameters used in travel searches.

fields.name: walkSpeed
fields.description: Max walk speed along streets, in meters per second

fields.name: bikeSpeed
fields.description: Max bike speed along streets, in meters per second

fields.name: carSpeed
fields.description: Max car speed along streets, in meters per second

fields.name: maxWalkDistance
fields.description: The maximum distance (in meters) the user is willing to walk for access/egress legs.

fields.name: maxTransferWalkDistance
fields.description: The maximum distance (in meters) the user is willing to walk for transfer legs.

fields.name: maxPreTransitTime
fields.description: The maximum time (in seconds) of pre-transit travel when using drive-to-transit (park and ride or kiss and ride).

fields.name: wheelChairAccessible
fields.description: Whether the trip must be wheelchair accessible.

fields.name: numItineraries
fields.description: The maximum number of itineraries to return.

fields.name: maxSlope
fields.description: The maximum slope of streets for wheelchair trips.

fields.name: showIntermediateStops
fields.description: Whether the planner should return intermediate stops lists for transit legs.

fields.name: transferPenalty
fields.description: An extra penalty added on transfers (i.e. all boardings except the first one).

fields.name: walkReluctance
fields.description: A multiplier for how bad walking is, compared to being in transit for equal lengths of time.

fields.name: stairsReluctance
fields.description: Used instead of walkReluctance for stairs.

fields.name: turnReluctance
fields.description: Multiplicative factor on expected turning time.

fields.name: elevatorBoardTime
fields.description: How long does it take to get on an elevator, on average.

fields.name: elevatorBoardCost
fields.description: What is the cost of boarding a elevator?

fields.name: elevatorHopTime
fields.description: How long does it take to advance one floor on an elevator?

fields.name: elevatorHopCost
fields.description: What is the cost of travelling one floor on an elevator?

fields.name: bikeRentalPickupTime
fields.description: Time to rent a bike.

fields.name: bikeRentalPickupCost
fields.description: Cost to rent a bike.

fields.name: bikeRentalDropOffTime
fields.description: Time to drop-off a rented bike.

fields.name: bikeRentalDropOffCost
fields.description: Cost to drop-off a rented bike.

fields.name: bikeParkTime
fields.description: Time to park a bike.

fields.name: bikeParkCost
fields.description: Cost to park a bike.

fields.name: carDropOffTime
fields.description: Time to park a car in a park and ride, w/o taking into account driving and walking cost.

fields.name: waitReluctance
fields.description: How much worse is waiting for a transit vehicle than being on a transit vehicle, as a multiplier.

fields.name: waitAtBeginningFactor
fields.description: How much less bad is waiting at the beginning of the trip (replaces waitReluctance on the first boarding).

fields.name: walkBoardCost
fields.description: This prevents unnecessary transfers by adding a cost for boarding a vehicle.

fields.name: bikeBoardCost
fields.description: Separate cost for boarding a vehicle with a bicycle, which is more difficult than on foot.

fields.name: otherThanPreferredRoutesPenalty
fields.description: Penalty added for using every route that is not preferred if user set any route as preferred. We return number of seconds that we are willing to wait for preferred route.

fields.name: transferSlack
fields.description: A global minimum transfer time (in seconds) that specifies the minimum amount of time that must pass between exiting one transit vehicle and boarding another.

fields.name: boardSlackDefault
fields.description: The boardSlack is the minimum extra time to board a public transport vehicle. This is the same as the 'minimumTransferTime', except that this also apply to to the first transit leg in the trip. This is the default value used, if not overridden by the 'boardSlackList'.

fields.name: boardSlackList
fields.description: List of boardSlack for a given set of modes.

fields.name: alightSlackDefault
fields.description: The alightSlack is the minimum extra time after exiting a public transport vehicle. This is the default value used, if not overridden by the 'alightSlackList'.

fields.name: alightSlackList
fields.description: List of alightSlack for a given set of modes.

fields.name: maxTransfers
fields.description: Maximum number of transfers returned in a trip plan.

fields.name: reverseOptimizeOnTheFly
fields.description: DEPRECATED - NOT IN USE IN OTP2.

fields.name: compactLegsByReversedSearch
fields.description: DEPRECATED - NOT IN USE IN OTP2.

fields.name: carDecelerationSpeed
fields.description: The deceleration speed of an automobile, in meters per second per second.

fields.name: carAccelerationSpeed
fields.description: The acceleration speed of an automobile, in meters per second per second.

fields.name: ignoreRealTimeUpdates
fields.description: When true, realtime updates are ignored during this search.

fields.name: disableRemainingWeightHeuristic
fields.description: If true, the remaining weight heuristic is disabled.

fields.name: onlyTransitTrips
fields.description: Accept only paths that use transit (no street-only paths).

fields.name: disableAlertFiltering
fields.description: Option to disable the default filtering of GTFS-RT alerts by time.

fields.name: geoIdElevation
fields.description: Whether to apply the ellipsoid->geoid offset to all elevations in the response.

fields.name: version
fields.description: Maven version

fields.name: buildTime
fields.description: OTP Build timestamp

types.name: ServiceJourney
types.description: A planned vehicle journey with passengers.

fields.name: transportSubmode
fields.description: The transport submode of the journey, if different from lines transport submode. NOT IMPLEMENTED

fields.name: publicCode
fields.description: Publicly announced code for service journey, differentiating it from other service journeys for the same line.

fields.name: privateCode
fields.description: For internal use by operators.

fields.name: wheelchairAccessible
fields.description: Whether service journey is accessible with wheelchair.

fields.name: bikesAllowed
fields.description: Whether bikes are allowed on service journey.

fields.name: quays
fields.description: Quays visited by service journey

fields.name: passingTimes
fields.description: Returns scheduled passing times only - without realtime-updates, for realtime-data use 'estimatedCalls'

fields.name: estimatedCalls
fields.description: Returns scheduled passingTimes for this ServiceJourney for a given date, updated with realtime-updates (if available). NB! This takes a date as argument (default=today) and returns estimatedCalls for that date and should only be used if the date is known when creating the request. For fetching estimatedCalls for a given trip.leg, use leg.serviceJourneyEstimatedCalls instead.

args.name: date
args.description: Date to get estimated calls for. Defaults to today.

fields.name: pointsOnLink
fields.description: Detailed path travelled by service journey.

fields.name: situations
fields.description: Get all situations active for the service journey.

fields.name: bookingArrangements
fields.description: Booking arrangements for flexible services.

enumValues.name: noImpact
enumValues.description: Situation has no impact on trips.

enumValues.name: slight
enumValues.description: Situation has a small impact on trips.

enumValues.name: normal
enumValues.description: Situation has an impact on trips (default).

enumValues.name: severe
enumValues.description: Situation has a severe impact on trips.

types.name: StopPlace
types.description: Named place where public transport may be accessed. May be a building complex (e.g. a station) or an on-street location.

fields.name: weighting
fields.description: Relative weighting of this stop with regards to interchanges. NOT IMPLEMENTED

fields.name: transportMode
fields.description: The transport modes of quays under this stop place.

fields.name: transportSubmode
fields.description: The transport submode serviced by this stop place. NOT IMPLEMENTED

fields.name: quays
fields.description: Returns all quays that are children of this stop place

args.name: filterByInUse
args.description: If true only quays with at least one visiting line are included.

fields.name: parent
fields.description: Returns parent stop for this stop

fields.name: estimatedCalls
fields.description: List of visits to this stop place as part of vehicle journeys.

args.name: startTime
args.description: DateTime for when to fetch estimated calls from. Default value is current time

args.name: numberOfDepartures
args.description: Limit the total number of departures returned.

args.name: numberOfDeparturesPerLineAndDestinationDisplay
args.description: Limit the number of departures per line and destination display returned. The parameter is only applied when the value is between 1 and 'numberOfDepartures'.

args.name: whiteListed
args.description: Parameters for indicating the only authorities and/or lines or quays to list estimatedCalls for

args.name: whiteListedModes
args.description: Only show estimated calls for selected modes.

enumValues.name: foot
enumValues.description: Walk only

enumValues.name: bicycle
enumValues.description: Bike only. This can be used as access/egress, but transfers will still be walk only.

enumValues.name: bike_park
enumValues.description: Bike to a bike parking area, then walk the rest of the way. Direct mode and access mode only.

enumValues.name: bike_rental
enumValues.description: Walk to a bike rental point, bike to a bike rental drop-off point, and walk the rest of the way. This can include bike rental at fixed locations or free-floating services.

enumValues.name: car
enumValues.description: Car only. Direct mode only.

enumValues.name: car_park
enumValues.description: Start in the car, drive to a parking area, and walk the rest of the way. Direct mode and access mode only.

enumValues.name: car_pickup
enumValues.description: Walk to a pickup point along the road, drive to a drop-off point along the road, and walk the rest of the way. This can include various taxi-services or kiss & ride.

types.name: String
types.description: Built-in String

types.name: SystemNotice
types.description: A system notice is used to tag elements with system information for debugging or other system related purpose. One use-case is to run a routing search with 'debugItineraryFilter: true'. This will then tag itineraries instead of removing them from the result. This make it possible to inspect the itinerary-filter-chain. A SystemNotice only have english text, because the primary user are technical staff, like testers and developers.

types.name: Time
types.description: Time using the format: `HH:MM:SS`. Example: `18:25:43`

fields.name: time
fields.description: Local time

fields.name: dayOffset
fields.description: Number of days offset from base line time

types.name: TimetabledPassingTime
types.description: Scheduled passing times. These are not affected by real time updates.

fields.name: arrival
fields.description: Scheduled time of arrival at quay

fields.name: departure
fields.description: Scheduled time of departure from quay

fields.name: timingPoint
fields.description: Whether this is a timing point or not. Boarding and alighting is not allowed at timing points.

fields.name: forBoarding
fields.description: Whether vehicle may be boarded at quay.

fields.name: forAlighting
fields.description: Whether vehicle may be alighted at quay.

fields.name: requestStop
fields.description: Whether vehicle will only stop on request.

fields.name: bookingArrangements
fields.description: Booking arrangements for flexible service. NOT IMPLEMENTED

types.name: TransportMode
types.description: NOT IMPLEMENTED

types.name: TransportModeSlack
types.description: Used to specify board and alight slack for a given modes.

inputFields.name: slack
inputFields.description: The slack used for all given modes.

inputFields.name: modes
inputFields.description: List of modes for witch the given slack apply.

types.name: TransportModeSlackType
types.description: Used to specify board and alight slack for a given modes.

types.name: Trip
types.description: Description of a travel between two places.

fields.name: dateTime
fields.description: The time and date of travel

fields.name: metadata
fields.description: The trip request metadata.

fields.name: fromPlace
fields.description: The origin

fields.name: toPlace
fields.description: The destination

fields.name: tripPatterns
fields.description: A list of possible trip patterns

fields.name: messageEnums
fields.description: A list of possible error messages as enum

fields.name: messageStrings
fields.description: A list of possible error messages in cleartext

fields.name: debugOutput
fields.description: Information about the timings for the trip generation

types.name: TripPattern
types.description: List of legs constituting a suggested sequence of rides and links for a specific trip.

fields.name: startTime
fields.description: Time that the trip departs.

fields.name: endTime
fields.description: Time that the trip arrives.

fields.name: duration
fields.description: Duration of the trip, in seconds.

fields.name: directDuration
fields.description: NOT IMPLEMENTED.

fields.name: waitingTime
fields.description: How much time is spent waiting for transit to arrive, in seconds.

fields.name: distance
fields.description: Total distance for the trip, in meters. NOT IMPLEMENTED

fields.name: walkTime
fields.description: How much time is spent walking, in seconds.

fields.name: walkDistance
fields.description: How far the user has to walk, in meters.

fields.name: legs
fields.description: A list of legs. Each leg is either a walking (cycling, car) portion of the trip, or a ride leg on a particular vehicle. So a trip where the use walks to the Q train, transfers to the 6, then walks to their destination, has four legs.

fields.name: systemNotices
fields.description: Get all system notices.

fields.name: weight
fields.description: Generalized cost or weight of the itinerary. Used for debugging.

types.name: TripSearchData
types.description: Trips search metadata.

fields.name: searchWindowUsed
fields.description: The search-window used in the current trip request. Use the value in the next request and set the request 'dateTime' to 'nextDateTime' or 'prevDateTime' to get the previous/next "window" of results. No duplicate trips should be returned, unless a trip is delayed and new realtime-data is available.Unit: minutes.

fields.name: nextDateTime
fields.description: This is the suggested search time for the "next page" or time window. Insert it together with the 'searchWindowUsed' in the request to get a new set of trips following in the time-window AFTER the current search.

fields.name: prevDateTime
fields.description: This is the suggested search time for the "previous page" or time-window. Insert it together with the 'searchWindowUsed' in the request to get a new set of trips preceding in the time-window BEFORE the current search.

fields.name: startTime
fields.description: Start of validity period

fields.name: endTime
fields.description: End of validity period

enumValues.name: noInformation
enumValues.description: There is no accessibility information for the stopPlace/quay.

enumValues.name: possible
enumValues.description: Boarding wheelchair-accessible serviceJourneys is possible at this stopPlace/quay.

enumValues.name: notPossible
enumValues.description: Wheelchair boarding/alighting is not possible at this stop.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: An enum describing valid locations where a directive can be placed

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on queries.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on mutations.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on fields.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on fragment definitions.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on fragment spreads.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on inline fragments.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on a schema SDL definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on a scalar SDL definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an object SDL definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on a field SDL definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on a field argument SDL definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an interface SDL definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an union SDL definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an enum SDL definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an enum value SDL definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an input object SDL definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an input object field SDL definition.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Introspection defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: 'A list of all directives supported by this server.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: 'If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given __Type is

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

fields.name: uri
fields.description: URI

fields.name: label
fields.description: Label

types.name: placeAtDistanceConnection
types.description: A connection to a list of items.

fields.name: edges
fields.description: a list of edges

fields.name: pageInfo
fields.description: details about this specific page

types.name: placeAtDistanceEdge
types.description: An edge in a connection

fields.name: node
fields.description: The item at the end of the edge

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: cursor marks a unique position or index into the connection

types.name: quayAtDistanceConnection
types.description: A connection to a list of items.

fields.name: edges
fields.description: a list of edges

fields.name: pageInfo
fields.description: details about this specific page

types.name: quayAtDistanceEdge
types.description: An edge in a connection

fields.name: node
fields.description: The item at the end of the edge

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: cursor marks a unique position or index into the connection

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if`'argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks the field or enum value as deprecated

args.name: reason
args.description: The reason for the deprecation
